body_html:
@7oud The problem is caused by libFuzzer which is git submodule bloaty of gRPC. In my solution, you need download libFuzzer from https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/llvm-project/llvm/lib/Fuzzer/ (using version 273735e) and build your own git repo libFuzzer. Then, you need fork bloaty and gRPC to your own branch. Then, delete submodule libFuzzer in your bloaty repo and add your libFuzzer repo to your bloaty repo as submodule. And do this to your gRPC repo again. Finally, you need change GRPC_URL and GRPC_TAG to your own repo in tensorflow-master\tensorflow\contrib\cmake\external\grpc.cmake

If you want a quick solution, you can change GRPC_URL and GRPC_TAG in tensorflow-master\tensorflow\contrib\cmake\external\grpc.cmake to:
GRPC_URL https://github.com/lzkmylz/grpc
GRPC_TAG 4446434eab7bfa9c7af000fc043ce9ecc267efdd

After this modification, you can compile it with some warning and generate tensorflow.dll and tensorflow.lib.

body:
@7oud The problem is caused by libFuzzer which is git submodule bloaty of gRPC. In my solution, you need download libFuzzer from https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/llvm-project/llvm/lib/Fuzzer/ (using version 273735e) and build your own git repo libFuzzer. Then, you need fork bloaty and gRPC to your own branch. Then, delete submodule libFuzzer in your bloaty repo and add your libFuzzer repo to your bloaty repo as submodule. And do this to your gRPC repo again. Finally, you need change GRPC_URL and GRPC_TAG to your own repo in tensorflow-master\tensorflow\contrib\cmake\external\grpc.cmake

If you want a quick solution, you can change GRPC_URL and GRPC_TAG in tensorflow-master\tensorflow\contrib\cmake\external\grpc.cmake to:
GRPC_URL https://github.com/lzkmylz/grpc
GRPC_TAG 4446434eab7bfa9c7af000fc043ce9ecc267efdd

After this modification, you can compile it with some warning and generate tensorflow.dll and tensorflow.lib.
